page.title: 04Industry In Cheshunt
page.content: The main industrial centre in this area is down Delamare Road.The main type of industry is light industry such as engineering and printing. A hundred years ago the main industry in Cheshunt was glasshouses,Cheshunt had good soil,plenty of water and was in easy reach of Covent Garden.By 1953 there were 1,200 acres of land under glass.The most important glasshouses were those run by Rochfords.They concentrated on growing plants.Today only 600 acres are under glass. A new industry to develop in Cheshunt is Tesco.Tesco have built a superstore at Brookfield Farm.They also have offices and warehouses down Delamare Road.They have brought alot of jobs to this area.From a survey of 30 people most worked in offices.Only 1 was unemployed.This is unusual since there are 3 million unemployed in the country
